award_title: NSF/Bio-DFG: Supramolecular organization of the antigen processing machinery in the ER membrane
subject: Making super-resolution methods actually reusable
body:
Hi Dr. Bewersdorf,

I came across your NSF project on ER nanomorphology and the peptide loading complex—interesting work bridging advanced imaging (DNA-PAINT, 4Pi-SMS) with structural biology.

NSF increasingly expects computational methods to be accessible and reusable, but demonstrating that in practice is harder than checking a box on a data management plan. That's what we're working on with Ouro—a way to make computational work discoverable, reusable, and citable—so methods live on as infrastructure, not just text in a methods section.

Given the imaging and analysis pipelines involved in your work, this might be relevant.

Happy to give you a quick peek if it's useful. And with winter break approaching, hope you have a restful holiday.

Best,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
